folder: Trinity Place & Thames Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
90-88, 86-78 and (part of) 76-70 Trinity Place, at, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of Thames Street (right, not shown), showing consecutively, the New York University School of Commerce (Wall Street divisions), the New York Curb Exchange and Trinity Court building. Also shown is Trinity Grave Yard and a portion of the Ninth Ave. Elevated Line on Trinity Place.

Subsequent to 1921.

Ewing Galloway.

folder: Cedar Street & Trinity Place, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
116-118 Cedar Street, south side, between Trinity Place and Greenwich Street.
June 1, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing a closer view.
June 22, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Thames Street & Trinity Place, Manhattan, NY
text:
Thames Street, west from, but not including Trinity Place, to and including Greenwich Street, showing a silhouette of a portion of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line, against a 3 1/2-story house, No. 126 on the latter Street. In the background is visible part of the 28-story West Street Building on the N.F. corner of West and Albany Streets.

July 5, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Trinity Place & Thames Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
88-90 Trinity Place at the South West corner of Thames Street, showing the New York University School of Commerce, Wall Street Division, as seen from Trinity Church Grave Yard. Also shown, is a portion of the Sixth Avenue Elevated Line.
August 7th, 1929

(2)
The same taken from the West side of Trinity Place and Thames Street.
May 4th, 1941

(3)
The same from a point South of Cedar Street.
May 4th, 1941

Photographs by,
P.L. Sperr,

folder: Trinity Place & Cedar Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) Trinity Place, west side, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Cedar Street, showing the St. Peter's (R.C.) Girl's School. Also shown (foreground) is a portion of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line.

August 20, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing a view farther south.

June 2, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, from a different angle, viewing northward.

June 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Trinity Place & Thames Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) Trinity Place, West Side and North from Thames Street, showing the St. Peter's Parochial School for Girls. (R.C.) It is located at the South West corner of Cedar Street. A portion of the Sixth Avenue "L", since demolished, may be seen in picture. June 4th, 1933

(2) Same from South West corner of Cedar Street. May 4th, 1941

(3) Same from a different angle. May 4th, 1940

Photographs by, P.L. Sperr,

folder: Trinity Place & Cedar Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Trinity Place, west side, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Cedar Street.

June 2, 1933
P. L. Sperr, photographer

folder: Trinity Place & Cedar Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) Trinity Place, West Side and North from, but not including Cedar Street, There is also shown a portion of the Sixth Avenue "I". The intersection shown is Liberty Street.

P.L.Sperr, 
 
June 4th, 1933

(2) Trinity Place, North of Cedar Street after the removal of the "I".

P.L.Sperr, 
 
July 17th, 1939

(3) Trinity Place, North across Thames Street, (rear of Trinity Church and Grave Yard,) also the Trinity Building on Sixth Avenue. The "I" was removed 1940-41.

P.L.Sperr, 
 
March 4th, 1939

folder: Trinity Place & Cedar Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Trinity Place, east side, north from but not including Cedar to and including Liberty Streets. (Trinity Place is called Church Street, north of Liberty Street.)

June 23, 1933

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Trinity Place #72-76, Manhattan, NY
title: Trinity Place #72-76

folder: Trinity Place & Cedar Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Trinity Place, east side, at Cedar Street, showing the 12-story building of the Fidelity Casualty Co., at the N.E. corner, and a portion of the 21-story United States Realty Building, at the S.E. corner.

March 5, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
